 FAQs




I have a question about...

 Entrance  What I can bring  Paying and getting cash  Parking my car/bike  Something else

Entrance Queries


Do you offer a season ticket for entry?
No we don’t, but by becoming a member of CAMRA at the festival your entry is free.
I want to meet up with a large group of friends, can we get a group deal?
We currently operate a corporate booking service, however this does not give any special discounts, just easier ticketing, invoicing and payment, large groups are more than welcome to use the same service.
I want to bring some clients/colleagues/guests to the festival can I organise a group entry?
Yes, this can be arranged with a VAT invoice for payment prior to entry via BACS or card. Please contact our Corporate Hospitality Team by emailing hospitality@cbcf.info. More details can be found on our Corporate Bookings page.
What time is the last entry?
You can see our last entry times on the Opening Times & Prices page.
Will I need proof of age?
If you're lucky to look young please make sure you bring proof of age with you. You will not be served if you appear under age and do not have proof of age with you. Please request an over 18 wrist band at the entrance if you believe you will be challenged regularly.

 Back to top


What I can bring


Are children allowed?
Yes, children under 18 are welcome. They must be with a responsible adult – a 17 year old with an 18 or 19 year old friend is not sufficient. As with any licensed premises, it is illegal for under 18s to buy (or attempt to buy) or consume alcohol. It’s also illegal to buy (or attempt to buy) alcohol for somebody under 18. See our Children Policy for more information
On Saturday, we will also be holding our Family Fun Day.
Are dogs allowed?
Well behaved dogs on leads with a responsible adult are welcome. Taps for drinking water are located around the site.
Is smoking/vaping or electronic cigarettes allowed?
The festival has a large outdoor area, where you can smoke and use electronic cigarettes. Please that smoking/vaping is not allowed inside or in the doorways of any of the marquees or tents, as well as in the toilets.
Can I bring my own food?
Yes, you are welcome to bring your own food and soft drinks. Please note that your bag will be searched on entry. Why not try our range of offerings from the World Food Court? We have freshly cooked food with great tastes from countries such as Spain, Thailand, the Caribbean, Italy, Argentina, South Africa and more still. We also have snacks available - sweets, pickled eggs, olives and nuts, ice cream on the Saturday and T shirts and hats for sale.
Can I bring my own alcohol in?
No, sorry. Only alcohol purchased on site can be consumed on site. Searches do take place at the entrance and alcohol found will be held at the entrance for collection on leaving, any person found within the festival with alcohol not purchased on site will be evicted.
Can I bring my own glass, tankard, stein or horn?
Yes, but we can only serve into a CE marked lined glass, so you are welcome to hire a festival glass and pour your drink into another vessel.

 Back to top


Paying and getting cash


Are the bars cash, card or tokens?
All bars accept cash or pre-purchased tokens. None of our bars have a debit card facility. Cashback is available from the Information & Membership tent.
Can I pay by card?
Yes - but only for your entrance and refundable glass deposit. We only accept cash at the bar, however, we operate a cashback facility at the Membership & Information tent in the centre of the beer garden (up to limit of £50 per transaction).
Is there a cash machine/cashback at the festival?
Cashback is available at the Membership & Information stand in the centre of the beer garden up to limit of £50 per transaction.

 Back to top


Parking my car/bike at the festival


Is there anywhere to secure my bicycle?
Yes, outside the festival there are places to chain a bike. The festival, its organisers and CAMRA take no responsibility for any items left there.
Is there a car park at the festival?
No. Please see our festival parking map for more information.
Can I park car near to festival?
There is small car park for Admirals Park just down the road from the entrance. Or see our map to other local carparks, we do prefer if you can use those opposed to the local roads.

 Back to top


Something Else


How much is each beer/cider as you walk around, or are they all different?
Not all prices are the same, prices are all similar to standard pub pricing. We serve real ales and ciders in third, half and pint measures to ensure you can try as many or as little as you like.
I’ve lost my wallet/hat/glasses/car keys, what should I do?
In the first instance please come back to the festival site: all lost property will remain on site until Monday afternoon. After this period please email hi@cbcf.info or call 01245 526899.
Are soft drinks available?
We offer free soft drinks to everyone, these are available from the soft drinks stand. Donation to the designated charities would be appreciated.
Is there anywhere to sit down at the festival or do I need to bring a chair?
Chairs and blankets are welcome, there are tables and chairs around the festival but only for around 15% of our customers due to space.
Can I camp over?
Unfortunately we are unable to offer camping to customers. We do provide camping to Volunteers who complete a minimum amount of working hours, consider volunteering if you wish to camp over.
Do I have to buy a glass?
There is a refundable £3 deposit on a Commemorative Festival Glass, which you can keep as a souvenir. The refund is only available if the glass is not damaged and while the refund counter is open.

 Back to top


Still can't find the answer to your question?

Get in contact with us so we can get it answered for you!
